intro: Talauma gioi, commonly known as the golden talauma, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow leaves and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its leaves are glossy and can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. Talauma gioi thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
